data.title: John Cleese Marries 'Soulmate' Jenny Wade, 41
data.meta_description: Comedy legend John Cleese has married Jennifer Wade, who is more than 30 years his junior, in an island ceremony.
data.text:
Monty Python legend John Cleese has tied the knot for the fourth time following an acrimonious divorce from his last wife.

Despite once joking that his friends would "knee-cap" him if he tried to walk down the aisle again, the 72-year-old wed Jennifer Wade, who at the age of 41 is three decades his junior, on the island of Mustique.

Cleese, who signed a deal with Hello! magazine, said: "I couldn't imagine being with anyone but Jenny. And with my record that's a remarkable thing to say."

His new wife is a former model and jewellery designer from Bath. She wore a pale pink satin gown while he wore a grey suit and white shoes.

The comedian is said to have "fought back tears" during the vows.

Cleese has previously been married to his Fawlty Towers co-star and co-writer Connie Booth, Barbara Trentham and Alice Faye Eichelberger who are all from the US.

His divorce from Eichelberger was a famously expensive one, costing him Â£12m. He subsequently launched his first solo comedy shows, which he named the Alimony Tour.

The comic and actor, who starred in movies such as A Fish Called Wanda, told Hello!: "I never felt there was anything wrong with the institution of marriage - it was my ability to choose the right person."

His bride insisted their age gap was not a problem and said: "We're kindred spirits. When people see us together, they immediately get it."
